content.body:
The test is wrong. I find it odd we consider this to be legal as well, but I suppose that's JS for you:
```js
var of = { 3: [4] };
for (of of of[1, 2, 3]) { console.log(of); } // prints: 4
```
content.formatted_body:
The test is wrong. I find it odd we consider this to be legal as well, but I suppose that's JS for you:

var of = { 3: [4] };
for (of of of[1, 2, 3]) { console.log(of); } // prints: 4

content.body:
Is there interest in try-expressions to create return values?

- [Repo](https://github.com/arthurfiorette/proposal-try-operator)
- [Request for sponsorship/mentorship](https://x.com/arthurfiorette/status/1893829221446762903) from Arthur Fiorette
